text: Glycosmis superba is a plant of Borneo in the family Rutaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Latin meaning "splendid", referring to the leaves. ==Description== Glycosmis superba grows as a shrub or small tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The large leaves measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Glycosmis superba is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is forests from sea-level to altitude. ==References== superba Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1978
title: Glycosmis superba
